video:video.video:title: Why Choose an R-32 PTAC Unit?
video:video.video:description:
Switching to an R-32 PTAC system is not just about compliance with environmental regulations; it is also about improving operational efficiency. R-32 has a lower Global Warming Potential (GWP) and higher energy efficiency than R-410A, leading to significant energy savings (EPA Refrigerant Transition). Additionally, R-32 refrigerant has better heat transfer properties, which means PTAC units using it can cool and heat rooms faster while consuming less power

video:video.video:title: Benefits of R-32 PTAC Units
video:video.video:description: Benefits of R-32 PTAC Units 1. Superior Energy Efficiency R-32 refrigerant has a higher cooling capacity per gram compared to R-410A, allowing PTAC units to operate more efficiently. This translates to lower energy consumption, reducing monthly utility bills (ASHRAE Efficiency Standards). video:video.video:title: Why Choose an R-32 PTAC Unit?
video:video.video:description:
Switching to an R-32 PTAC system is not just about compliance with environmental regulations; it is also about improving operational efficiency. R-32 has a lower Global Warming Potential (GWP) and higher energy efficiency than R-410A, leading to significant energy savings (EPA Refrigerant Transition). Additionally, R-32 refrigerant has better heat transfer properties, which means PTAC units using it can cool and heat rooms faster while consuming less power
Best R-32 PTAC Units 1. Amana - Best O

video:video.video:title: What is a SPLIT system?
video:video.video:description:
What is a SPLIT system?
A split system is a type of air conditioner that has two separate units, one inside and one outside, that are connected by insulated tubes.
HVAC systems (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) play a vital role in creating comfortable indoor environments.
These systems involve an outdoor unit (compressor/condenser) and an indoor unit (air handler or coil and furnace), with the two connected via refrigerant lines and ductwork.

video:video.video:title: What is a SPLIT system?
video:video.video:description:
What is a SPLIT system?
A split system is a type of air conditioner that has two separate units, one inside and one outside, that are connected by insulated tubes.
HVAC systems (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) play a vital role in creating comfortable indoor environments.
These systems involve an outdoor unit (compressor/condenser) and an indoor unit (air handler or coil and furnace), with the two connected via refrigerant lines and ductwork.
